name: getChecked
content:
Gets the state of a checkbox or radioButton.

`getChecked()` is used to check whether a user has checked a checkbox or radio button by using the element ID. Check boxes are used when the user is asked to check a box if they agree with something, like an app privacy statement. Radio buttons are used when the user is asked to choose one item from a predefined group of options.

examples.name: Example: Finding the Checked Item
examples.description: Iterate over the radio buttons in a group to determine which one is selected each time the favorite button is clicked.

palette_params.name: id
palette_params.description: The unique identifier for the screen element. Must begin with a letter, contain no spaces, and may contain letters, digits, - and _.

short_description: Gets the state of a checkbox or radioButton.
tips: - A checkbox or radio button can also be created in design mode.
